Biodegradable materials made from natural plant-based sources like bagasse, potato starch or algae, for packaging and disposable products.
Sustainable and durable paper products made from recycled wood pulp, for stationery, filters, and packaging.
Eco-friendly textile alternatives made from natural fibres like hemp, flax or bamboo for apparel, sheets and curtains.
Low-energy lighting solutions like LED bulbs or solar-powered LED lights, replacing inefficient fluorescent and incandescent bulbs.
Solar-powered appliances and electronic devices that harness clean, renewable energy, replacing battery-operated appliances.
